intro: Alopecurus himalaicus, commonly known as the Himalayan mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its fine, hairy leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually greenish or pale blue, and it produces small, three-angled seeds. Alopecurus himalaicus is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions at high altitudes.
